result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the victims in this matter, or any business owned by them.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the Shullsburg Creamery or any of their employees. 
Defendant may travel out of the State, but shall provide advance notice to Court Services with any date and time, location, and individuals she will be with, limited to Illinois and Iowa.

3:39 PM Defendant Megan Lelia Knauer appeared by video.  Attorney Morgan Sauder appeared by phone for Megan Lelia Knauer.  Attorney Corinne Frutiger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Sauder gives argument in support of motion to modify bond.
Atty Frutiger has no objection to the motion being granted as drafted.
Court grants motion for bond modification; leaves in the provision that she notify court services re: travel; defendant may travel out of state to Illinois and Iowa.
Adjourned at 3:46 p.m.

Motion hearing on November 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:01 PM Defendant Megan Lelia Knauer in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Megan Lelia Knauer.  Attorney Corinne Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Sauder informs Court that discovery has been completed and parties are negotiating; requests to have the matter set over for another status conference.
Set over to 12/21/22 at 2:00 (15 min. by Zoom)
Atty Sauder moves for modification of bond to allow defendant to travel to Warren, Illinois.
Atty Frutiger does not have enough information to address the request and there is no written motion on file.
Atty Sauder can file motion by the end of the day.
Set for motion hearing 11/3/22 at 3:30 p.m. (15 min. by Zoom)
